titlestmt.titleproper: Howard R. Kemble research materials undated
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

bioghist.p: Howard R. Kemble was a Trustee of the Camden County Historical Society. He was the author along with Harry B. Weiss of They took to the waters; the forgotten mineral spring resorts of New Jersey and nearby Pennsylvania and Delaware.

scopecontent.p: Howard R. Kemble research file on New Jersey maritime history from the late 17th century to the 19th century. Cards are arranged by subject and alphabetically by person and vessel. Cards include brief entries, citations, and sometimes a copy of a pertinent clipping. Among the many subjects are: oystermen, physicians, sailmakers, boat lines, ferries, landings, taverns with nautical names, and maritime disasters. The collection also includes some business cards from the 20th century.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
